ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By the end of the course, I was able to communicate in Spanish about my family, school, daily life, other countries and peoples, food, and many descriptive words. Generally, I am now able to make small talk in Spanish.
I developed greater skills in comprehension of and listening to Spanish. I learned a great deal about Spanish speaking culture and have a greater appreciation for those cultures.

This is introductory Spanish, and you learn the basics of the language. Amazingly, after just one course you will be able to hold basic conversations, understand simple texts and even read a short novel. This course transmits an incredible amount of knowledge.
A great working knowledge of elementary Spanish reading, writing, speaking, and comprehension, as well as a basic knowledge of Spanish/Hispanic culture and history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I feel this course would be incredibly challenging for someone with no Spanish experience. I understand that the accompanying website is meant to teach basics but they should still be went over in class.

This course is amazing, but very intense. I think it provides the perfect environment for learning Spanish, but one should only take it if fully committed. You cannot miss classes or skip homework, you will be quickly left behind and it is nearly impossible to catch up. I think this course is pretty well optimized, of course your experience will depend strongly on whoever teaches your section.

Strengths of the course include daily engagement that does a good job at facilitating learning of Spanish. Weaknesses include a sometimes disjointed curriculum between the textbook and what we did in class (although this is a minor complaint).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially as I believe Spanish is an incredible language that is well taught here.

I would recommend this course for anyone who is committed to learning Spanish. For people who aren't sure or can't invest a lot of time, it would not be a good choice. This excellent class will teach you Spanish, but not for free.
I definitely would recommend this as the best way for anyone to begin their learning of the Spanish language.
